en.purpose: The purpose is to determine the El-Ganzouri Risk Index (EGRI) and stratify the risk for difficult airway.
en.use:
EGRI is a simple scoring system that helps in making preoperative stratification of patients into risk groups for the difficulty in visualizing laryngeal structures during rigid laryngoscopy after induction of general anesthesia. predicts the risk level for difficult airway in a patient undergoing anesthesia. 
It is the sum of points of all the 7 variables and ranges from 0 to 12. 

Variable	                                                                                                   Points

Mouth opening      	                                ≥4 cm	                                      0
	                                                        <4 cm	                                      1
Thyromental distance*                        >6.5 cm	                                      0
	                                                      6.0-6.5 cm	                              1
	                                                        <6.0 cm	                                      2
Modified Mallampati 
Classification                  I (soft palate, fauces, uvula, and pillars seen)	      0
	                               II (soft palate, fauces, and uvula seen)	              1
	                               III (soft palate and base of uvula seen)	              2
	                               IV (soft palate not visible)	                              2
Neck movement **                       >90°	                                                      0
	                                              80-90°	                                              1
	                                                <80°	                                              2
Ability to prognath***                        Yes	                                                      0
	                                                 No	                                                      1
Weight	                                <90 kg (198.4 lbs)	                                      0
	                                       90-110 kg (198.4-242.5 lbs)	                      1
	                                          >110 kg (242.5 lbs)	                              2
History of difficult intubation	          None	                                              0
	                                              Questionable	                                      1
	                                                  Definite	                                              2
* Thyromental distance was measured along a straight line from the thyroid notch to the lower border of the mandibular mentum with the head fully extended.
** Head and neck movement was measured as described by asking the patient to fully extend the head and neck ( Wilson et al). The range of motion from full extension through full flexion was categorized
***Ability to advance the lower jaw forward

Interpretation of EGRI 

EGRI  >=4   -   High Risk for difficult airway
EGRI  < 4    -    Low risk for difficult airway
en.misuse: Clinicians must understand the limitations of the predictive model and be prepared to take appropriate actions when unanticipated difficulty arises.

gt0001.text: El-Ganzouri Risk Index (EGRI) For Difficult Airway
gt0001.description: El-Ganzouri Risk Index (EGRI) is used in patients undergoing general anesthesia to predict the difficult airway for endotracheal intubation. The preoperative prediction of difficult airway for intubation can reduce the incidence of catastrophic complications or unnecessary maneuvers.

gt0003.description: Measurement of the mouth opening of the patient for laryngoscopy.

gt0004.description: Thyromental  distance was measured along a straight line from the thyroid notch to the lower border of the mandibular mentum with the head fully extended.

gt0005.description: Stratifies difficulty of endotracheal intubation based on anatomic features

gt0006.description: Head and neck movement was measured as described by asking the patient to fully extend the head and neck ( Wilson et al). The range of motion from full extension through full flexion was categorized.

gt0007.description: Ability to advance lower jaw forward

gt0008.description: Records if the patient has any history of difficult intubation

gt0012.description: Categorized based on the weight of the patient

gt0013.description: EGRI is the sum of the points of each  of the 7 variables.

gt0015.description: The preoperative patients are stratified to high/low risk group for difficult airway based on the EGRI.
